column1: When #COVID19 hit we got to work and brought $47 billion to Georgia to help hospitals small businesses communities. Together we will defeat this virus. https://t.co/voUt6DDUBm

Extremely encouraging news in the fight against #COVID19. With critical funding from the #CARESAct the U.S. is working to get a safe and effective vaccine to Americans as quickly as possible. https://t.co/3ACC4vUdly

The U.S. is continuing to work at record speed to develop effective vaccines and treatments for #COVID19. This week @HHSgov announced Georgia will receive nearly 2000 vials of a new antibody treatment for patients in our state. https://t.co/g1bHjB4N6Y
Georgia’s business-friendly climate continues to attract new jobs and investments even during #COVID19. https://t.co/gnuoLBWhTd
178 #Georgia nursing homes received nearly $7 million in @HHSGov performance payments for demonstrating significant reductions in #COVID19 related infections and deaths. https://t.co/eyNftMmuHa
We brought $47 BILLION to #Georgia to help hospitals small businesses and individuals respond to #COVID19. Together we will defeat this virus and emerge stronger. https://t.co/Cd0FmfNe3N

Before #COVID19 we created the greatest economic turnaround in U.S. history.   → 7.5 million new jobs → Highest middle-class income → Lowest African American Asian Hispanic unemployment → 6.6 million lifted out of poverty

#Georgia has made great progress in our fight against #COVID19 but we can’t take our foot off the gas. Wash your hands watch your distance and wear your mask to protect yourself and others! https://t.co/PhudT0uY8Q

Protecting our most vulnerable continues to be a top priority as we fight #COVID19. These #CARESAct funds will support additional testing and personnel needs in Georgia’s nursing homes and long-term care facilities. https://t.co/dQ1BpqZVIS
Senate Republicans put on the floor a #COVID19 relief package that focused on getting people back to work getting kids back to school and beating this virus. Democrats rejected it.

Bonnie & I both tested negative for #COVID19 today. We got tested proactively and continue to urge all Georgians to stay vigilant as we fight this virus. Remember to follow the 3W’s: wash your hands watch your distance and wear your mask!
The bipartisan #CARESAct has been instrumental in helping our country get through the #COVID19 crisis.  Read my latest op-ed in @mdjonline: https://t.co/R2lhySEMSP

Across the state Georgians are rising to the challenge and helping one another. I’m encouraged by meetings with military small business and healthcare leaders. We’re going to defeat #COVID19 together. https://t.co/wytsT9aGxT
The Paycheck Protection Program helped Atlanta Pediatric Therapy in Doraville keep its employees and continue serving patients during #COVID19. #FacesOfPPP #PPPinGA https://t.co/U3d43Z03Q7
We're going to defeat #COVID19 and eventually get back to normal. Follow the 3 W's to protect yourself and others! https://t.co/ohEFzax6Dl

1.5 million #Georgia jobs have been saved by the Paycheck Protection Program. Great to be in Smyrna today to hear from small businesses that received #PPP loans to help bridge the gap during #COVID19. https://t.co/p9npO0rRVi
The #COVID19 crisis has tested the strength of our great state but it has also revealed the depths of our kindness as a people. Read my op-ed in @hhjnews: https://t.co/ZbwrUBi8er
Good visit to Fox Factory in Gainesville. Throughout the #COVID19 crisis Fox Factory has continued to hire workers. https://t.co/ha3EGT8mNp

Honored to visit with healthcare workers at Northeast Georgia Medical Center and hear directly about #COVID19 response efforts. Grateful for the work they’re doing on the frontlines of this crisis! https://t.co/uxnAoYmRrK
If you’ve recovered from #COVID19 consider donating plasma to help others. https://t.co/UT4lTLaxQg

The United States is working at record speed to develop effective vaccines and treatments for #COVID19.  Yesterday Georgia received an additional 6600 vials of remdesivir from @HHSgov. https://t.co/M0gxCuNCUY
Wear a mask practice social distancing wash your hands often. Together we can #slowthespread of #COVID19. https://t.co/o5zP0vMFNw

We all play a role in slowing the spread of #COVID19. Wear a mask practice social distancing wash your hands often.  Visit https://t.co/8jrU0gN5yO for the latest on how to protect yourself and others. https://t.co/OR3fvFeje8

As a member of the HBCU Caucus I’m proud to support GA’s Historically Black Colleges & Universities in the U.S. Senate.   The @Albany_Herald wrote about our work to help HBCUs recover from the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/gZLLIWjef3
This is a huge step forward in Georgia’s fight against #COVID19. Thanks to @GeorgiaGuard and the dedicated public health officials who assisted in this effort. https://t.co/7a0LzVZtdp
Community banks have been true heroes during the #COVID19 crisis.   They quickly stepped up to get #PPP loans out to small businesses and helped save millions of jobs. https://t.co/Liaitgxrff

My team and I are focused on helping all Georgians get through this crisis.  Through our weekly #COVID19 constituent conference calls we have reached out to thousands of Georgians to provide updates share resources and answer questions.   Thanks to all who have participated! https://t.co/qgdniQbvwt

While we still have more work to do it’s clear that President @realDonaldTrump’s strong action to support American workers and small businesses throughout the #COVID19 crisis paid off. https://t.co/k073kIMgFJ
It’s time to take a hard look at whether regulations waived during #COVID19 were ever needed in the first place.  Here’s the letter I sent to @OMBPress: https://t.co/2wY0ujhYjn
If you’ve recovered from #COVID19 please consider donating plasma to help others fight off this virus. Learn how you can donate at https://t.co/XsjsR2esmi. #TheFightIsInUs https://t.co/UTLrrnLPKp
The #COVID19 crisis shows how critical broadband access is in rural America.   Read my op-ed with @SenKevinCramer & @SenJoniErnst here: https://t.co/HuNn7opJid
.@CVSHealth will open 23 new drive-thru #COVID19 testing sites in Georgia tomorrow. Learn more and find a list of  locations here: https://t.co/iqcW0ElA6Q
Extremely generous donation by SK innovation. Thanks for supporting Georgia’s fight against #COVID19! https://t.co/97whTnaAef
Thanks to @AUG_University President Dr. Brooks Keel for giving #TeamPerdue an informative update on #COVID19 testing in Georgia. https://t.co/sBrvWbL4JT
Georgia is set to receive $260 million in federal funding to increase #COVID19 testing capacity. This is a critical element of our phased approach to get America back to work. https://t.co/pesLF8oapL

Thank you to all of our nation’s nurses especially those on the frontlines of the #COVID19 crisis. You are heroes and we’re grateful for the sacrifices you make every day. #NationalNursesDay #HealthcareHeroes https://t.co/HHlZGtiE3Y

Extremely impressed by how @FortBenning has responded to #COVID19. They adapted to the situation implemented new protocols and found a way to keep training soldiers.   Thanks to @SecArmy for taking time to see this firsthand. https://t.co/JPZDQcB5wq

ICYMI: #COVID19 testing is now available to asymptomatic individuals in Georgia counties hardest hit by the virus and all critical infrastructure workers.   Learn more from @AUG_Health: https://t.co/OuYz7wPZEB

Next week @SenToddYoung @SenatorDurbin @ChrisCoons & I will introduce a bipartisan bill to address our nation’s shortage of doctors and nurses which has been exacerbated by the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/0ksZnRm4rM

By implementing new safety measures @FortBenning has been able to continue training operations during the #COVID19 crisis. Rest assured that our military remains ready to face any challenge.  (Photos: Patrick Albright @USArmy) https://t.co/OZGJDXgZAq
Honored to welcome @SecArmy back to Georgia today to see how @FortBenning has responded to the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/TlJ435JndQ
Georgians experiencing #COVID19 symptoms can call 706-721-1852 visit https://t.co/7nRgZWQZYb or download the AU Health ExpressCare app to receive a free virtual screening.

WHO appears to have shown remarkable deference to the Chinese government throughout the #COVID19 crisis.   I’ve joined other members of @SenateForeign in calling for an independent review of WHO’s response. https://t.co/9osvktHcbm

President Trump’s agenda created the greatest economic turnaround in U.S. history. However the #COVID19 crisis and resulting shutdown of much of our country has taken a serious toll on our economy. (1/2)
NEW: #IRS launched a website where you can check the status of your #COVID19 relief check and enter direct deposit information for faster delivery. https://t.co/RfdkM747G4

.@AUG_Health has done incredible work throughout the #COVID19 crisis. Now they’re offering free virtual COVID-19 screenings to Georgians across the state. This is a great tool to use before visiting a doctor’s office. https://t.co/4M2Wn6fiIM

Thanks to @AARP for helping spread the word that all eligible Social Security beneficiaries will receive #COVID19 relief checks.   No action is necessary and beneficiaries will receive the payment the same way they receive Social Security benefits. https://t.co/r7Oui9fxJ0
This new rapid testing site at @GeorgiaTech is a huge step forward in our fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/shEenFFlmn

What are the qualifications for #PaycheckProtectionProgram?  Are Social Security recipients eligible for #COVID19 relief checks?  How will IRS know where to send my payment?  These questions and more are answered here → https://t.co/1HZBjBixz1 #gapol

Many churches are moving their services online during the #COVID19 crisis. I’ll be watching @rockspringslive Pastor Benny Tate’s message online tomorrow. You can watch here at 8:00 9:30 or 11:00 AM: https://t.co/YzBw2COld5

We want to help you stay healthy safe and informed during the #COVID19 crisis. At https://t.co/oiNHBLsXWi you can find:   → FAQs and answers → Info on coronavirus relief bills → Federal and state resources https://t.co/x7sAcE19ae
ICYMI – I joined @WDUNRadio on Friday to discuss the response to #COVID19.   Listen here: https://t.co/QISLt0ICg3
3.) @Aflac CEO Dan Amos and his wife donated $1 million to help Piedmont Columbus Regional treat COVID-19 patients. https://t.co/YNIkpmeXPL
Sharing 3 good news stories to end the day:  1.) Augusta National is donating $2 million toward coronavirus testing and relief. https://t.co/lA0fKkqsat
Thanks @Delta for helping medical volunteers travel where they’re needed most. #COVID19 https://t.co/31PPWfxGWa

#USNSMercy and #USNSComfort have a long history of providing medical care during times of crisis.   These hospital ships will treat non-coronavirus patients so local resources can be focused on #COVID19. https://t.co/HSGuWMVNn1
I joined WABE’s “Did You Wash Your Hands?” podcast to discuss our medical and economic response to #COVID19.   Listen here: https://t.co/dYPJZ8DLr7

We all play a role in stopping the spread of #coronavirus.  Wash your hands often. Stay home if you're sick. Keep a safe distance from others.  For more information visit https://t.co/c93wWFX64y. https://t.co/qSt55ch8eY
No virus will ever break the American spirit.  RT to share your appreciation for the heroes on the frontlines of the #coronavirus crisis! https://t.co/9st3n0Ea9O

I’ve encouraged the Administration to boost resources for Academic Medical Centers like those at @AUG_University and @EmoryUniversity which are able to return #COVID19 test results more quickly than traditional labs. https://t.co/t9Xz65pyFA

Thank you to health workers truck drivers janitors grocers and so many others who have stepped up during the #COVID19 crisis.   I introduced a Senate resolution today to recognize these critical care workers. https://t.co/ZtR02gAOE0
Just wrapped up a conference call with @GAChamber to discuss how the coronavirus is impacting Georgia businesses and what we can do to help solve temporary liquidity issues. https://t.co/LN4cYlAxU0

The federal government’s #1 focus should be helping companies make payroll to keep as many people employed as possible. If we inject liquidity into the market people will still have a job to go back to when #COVID19 is contained. https://t.co/gYK7LVuMgO
Appreciate the opportunity to talk with Georgia Hospital Association members about the #coronavirus response and how we can help. https://t.co/PvRnelQ4Fe
Joining @Varneyco shortly to discuss the #coronavirus. Tune in if you can! #gapol
Wanted to give everyone a brief update on how we're responding to the #coronavirus crisis and what you can do to protect yourself and your family. https://t.co/iw2djB4Xxj
Welcomed news for Georgia small business owners. @SBAgov emergency loans are now available to impacted businesses in all 159 counties. #coronavirus https://t.co/n9TFlsIJR1
The bipartisan #coronavirus relief package passed today will directly support the health and economic security of American families and workers.   My full statement: https://t.co/gZtDodVj9F

I support @SenRonJohnson's amendment which will offer financial support to #coronavirus-impacted workers without instituting big government mandates that hurt small businesses. https://t.co/zT58hDGU7C

As a business guy I know small businesses need flexibility and certainty especially during the coronavirus pandemic.   We’ve outlined some specific actions @USTreasury @SBAgov and others can take right now to support small businesses. https://t.co/mxERWeX6iM
.@Mike_Pence is exactly right. Government action alone will not stop the coronavirus. We need the American people's help.  Read @VP's op-ed in @USAToday: https://t.co/eCz8eMqUUJ
Georgia is at the forefront of the #coronavirus response. Thanks to Atlanta-based @UPS for assisting with logistics for new drive-up #COVID19 test sites. https://t.co/oGLSuR8MuP

Glad to see companies like @DollarGeneral finding creative ways to serve their customers during #coronavirus. Starting today DG’s first hour of operation will be dedicated to seniors. https://t.co/3WbFOEynPH

America has faced big challenges before and we will get through this together. Please stay vigilant and follow @CDCgov’s advice.  Take extra precautions.  Wash your hands often. Practice social distancing.  #coronavirus #COVID19 #StopTheSpread https://t.co/hpr3wkTfDf
All Georgians and Americans play a role in combating the spread of #coronavirus so please continue taking extra precautions to protect yourself your family and your community. https://t.co/d4uSggLE8R
By declaring a national emergency today President @realDonaldTrump is providing critical resources to help authorities safeguard public health. #coronavirus
This is the right move by President Trump. We want to make sure federal state and local authorities have every resource they need to fight #coronavirus. https://t.co/lY44JiTN6V
Visit @CDCgov’s #COVID19 FAQ page to learn more about #coronavirus symptoms how it spreads and how to protect yourself. https://t.co/csM84qrnhk
Please continue taking extra #coronavirus precautions and follow guidance from @cdcgov and @GaDPH. We all play a role in combating the spread of this virus.

President Trump’s visit to Georgia on Friday emphasizes his commitment to leading in our fight against the #coronavirus and indicates how important @CDCgov is in that fight.  (Official @WhiteHouse Photos by Shealah Craighead) https://t.co/DKeK7B9QNO

Honored to be with President @realDonaldTrump today as he visits the Atlanta-based @CDCgov. The CDC has a critical role in combating #coronavirus and I’m proud of the work they do every day to keep Americans safe.
Georgia’s own @CDCgov is on the front lines of the coronavirus response. I’m so proud of the work they do every day to keep Americans safe. https://t.co/bTWIQiEmE7
Joining @MorningsMaria in about 5 minutes to discuss the latest on the coronavirus. #gapol

Keeping Georgians healthy and safe is my top priority. I’m closely monitoring the cases of coronavirus in Georgia and urge everyone to take extra precautions and follow advice from @CDCgov. #COVID2019

.@POTUS & @VP are taking the coronavirus very seriously.   The United States is: ·    Expediting vaccine development ·    Educating state and local officials ·    Taking steps to ensure travelers do not spread the virus   Be sure to follow @CDCgov for updates.
